docs.snippet: SIR: You have not done men the honor to send me a copy of your minority report on the "Metropolitan Health Bill," a courtesy which I had reason to expect at your hands.

headline.main: THE METROPOLITAN HEALTH BILL.; Letter from Dr. Griscom to Hon. D.S. Coddington.

docs.lead_paragraph: SIR: You have not done men the honor to send me a copy of your minority report on the "Metropolitan Health Bill," a courtesy which I had reason to expect at your hands.

headline.main: LETTER FROM THE CORPORATION COUNSEL.; Reply of Hon. Greene C. Bronson to the Committee on Street Assessments.

docs.snippet: In the Senate, on Saturday, the bill to prevent frauds in laying out and opening streets in this City was ordered to a third reading; also the bill to provide for the construction of railroads in cities, and the bill to amend the law relative to the...
docs.lead_paragraph: In the Senate, on Saturday, the bill to prevent frauds in laying out and opening streets in this City was ordered to a third reading; also the bill to provide for the construction of railroads in cities, and the bill to amend the law relative to the Superintendent of Poor and the Coroners of Kings County. docs.snippet: The paper presented herewith was read by the author, Dr. A.K. GARONER of this City, to the Sanitary Association, and received the approval of this body.

headline.main: IMPORTANT SANITARY SUGGESTIONS.; Report to the Sanitary Association, by Dr. A.K. Gardner. CLEAN STREETS PUBLIC BATHS. PUBLIC URINALS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The paper presented herewith was read by the author, Dr. A.K. GARONER of this City, to the Sanitary Association, and received the approval of this body.

headline.main: AFFAIRS AT THE STATE CAPITAL.; PROCEEDINGS OF THE LEGISLATURE. SENATE. BILLS PASSED. AFTERNOON SESSION.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Supply bill was made the special order for this afternoon. BILLS ORDERED TO THIRD READING. To prevent frauds in laying out streets in NewYork; to provide for the construction of railroads in cities; to amend the law relating to the Superintendent of Poor and Coroners of Kings County.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the Senate yesterday, the bill to prevent frauds in laying out and opening streets in this City was ordered to a third reading; also the bill to provide for the construction of railroads in cities, and the bill to amend the law relative to the Superintendent of Poor and the Coroners of Kings County.

docs.snippet: Maj.-Gen. HUNTER seems likely to make his Southern Department thoroughly loyal, notwithstanding its inclusion of South Carolina. Wherever he advances the National flag the rebels either succumb or fly before it; and the following General Order, one...
docs.abstract: Editorial lauds Hunter order freeing slaves in areas under his command and employing them in military or in raising food for army
docs.lead_paragraph: Maj.-Gen. HUNTER seems likely to make his Southern Department thoroughly loyal, notwithstanding its inclusion of South Carolina. Wherever he advances the National flag the rebels either succumb or fly before it; and the following General Order, one of the most important of the campaign, and issued at Fort Pulaski the day after the surrender of that important fortress, shows how the number of loyal freemen in the State is likely to be increased:
